title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel set in the Jazz Age that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the deep South, as seen through the eyes of a young girl.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that explores a totalitarian regime and the dangers of surveillance and censorship.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that explores themes of love, reputation, and class distinction in 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age story about teenage alienation and rebellion, centered on the life of Holden Caulfield.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to seek revenge on the white whale Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical epic that intertwines the lives of several characters during the Napoleonic Wars in Russia.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure following Bilbo Baggins on his journey to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem recounting the adventures of Odysseus as he returns home from the Trojan War.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic horror novel about a scientist who creates a living being, with tragic consequences.
